column4: Hi there ! Is anyone know how to make my tv sound work in 9.04 ? I use a 7134 tv chip and run a p5q3 motherboard
I can see there's sound input in the viewmeter related to the tv activity but still no sound output
have you tried moving the stream to another output device in that pavucontrol window yet ?

haven't saw that yet, what do you recommend ? I have an output device that is my TV card, and Now that I've unclicked the 'shield' button, I can see the viewmeter moving accordlingly to the tv, but still no sound
looking at your former messages, hang on please

are you taking about the pulseaudio viewmeter ? if so, that indicates pulseaudio is getting something, try opening "pavucontrol" and moving the output stream to another device to see if you can get output somewhere

I think I was in the pulseaudio viewmeter, but now I see the viewmeter of pavucontrol, which activated once I've unclicked the 'shield' button in front of each saa7134 device (PCM,Analog, and monitor of Analog). What do you mean 'moving the output stream to another device' ? I don't see how to do that in pavucontrol.
there's a small dropdown indicator next to the un/mute symbol of each playback item, it offers a 'move stream' option
noticed that already, but there no other entry in this menu than "Default'
that's possible indeed, was hoping you had some of those virtual devices in there for pulseaudio, sorry
i take it you've already tried stopping all audio apps and restarting pulseaudio ?
you suggest I should stop pulseaudio ? would I have sound though ?
like Slart says, there could be a running pulseaudio daemon that's bogged down , try "killall pulseaudio; pulseaudio -D" to restart it
i wouldn't go down the route of removing pulseaudio just yet, see what a restart does first
too bad, i don't know anything on tvtime to be able to offer any real help there i'm afraid
well, that redirection was what i proposed to check earlier, only thing i could find is http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=723618
have you tried asking on pulseaudio irc yet ? http://www.pulseaudio.org/wiki/Community has the address
